About Gullfoss

Gullfoss, meaning "Golden Falls," is one of Iceland's most famous waterfalls. It cascades down two dramatic drops into a rugged canyon, making for a breathtaking sight. With a height of 32 meters and a width of 70 meters, it is an unmissable destination.

The waterfall is part of the Hvítá River, which originates from the Langjökull glacier. During sunny days, the mist from the falls creates beautiful rainbows, enhancing its magical appeal. Whether you visit in summer for lush green surroundings or winter when the falls are partially frozen, Gullfoss offers a mesmerizing experience year-round.
